options.content:
# Cloud Logs Export (CLE)

* [Repository Link](https://lqcjoo.bbl/jcucttq/mosrz-xboz-sugktpqe)

## How export works

Once a tenant has CLE enabled, a goroutine will be triggered
to export data for every interval. This triggering is controlled
by the `sync.list_objects_period` configuration. The interval will be
dictated by the `sync.interval` configuration.

If `sync.list_objects_period` is `10m` and `sync.interval` is `20m`,
every 10 minutes a goroutine will check if 20 minutes has passed since
the last interval. If that happened, it will spawn a new Copy Iteration.

### Copy Iteration

The copy iteration will:
- List index files for the current interval
- Make a list of all chunks that are part of the current interval.
  If PSE (per-stream export) is configured for this tenant and a valid filter
  is found, only chunks that are expected by the filter will be kept.
- Copy all chunks in the list above
- If the interval is crossing midnight, an audit of the current index will be triggered.
  If the audit fails because a chunk is missing, the timestamp position for this
  tenant is resetted to be 0:00:00 of that day. If it fails for another error it won't proceed
  but won't be resetted either.
- If all steps above succeed, the position is moved `sync.interval` minutes forward.

# Audit

## What audit is

Audit is a process that checks the integrity of a tenant state. We only
progress our export to a given tenant for a given day if its integrity is validated.

Two types of integrity checks are performed:
1. Index validation (New). This new checkage, implemented
as part of the PSE project, validates the exported index based on the original index present on our bucket.
The following checks are done:
  1.1 the stats of the copied index do match with the original index.
The stats have: number of chunks, bytes, entries, and streams.
  1.2 the chunkrefs are the same in both indexes.
  obs: If the tenant has PSE enabled, we use the configured filter when looking at the original index.
  For instance, when checking the stats, if the tenant has PSE configured, we will use the configured
  filter with the original index vs the filtered index without filters.
2. Chunks validation. This checkage iterates over the exported index list of
chunks and makes sure all of them are present in the customer bucket with the same size
as the chunk on our bucket.

`Obs: Audit uses the new Thanos object storage client.`

# Per-Stream Export (PSE)

PSE is a new CLE feature that allows exporting
only data matching a especific stream selector. 

Both the export and the audit code had to be adapted
to support the per-stream filtering capability.

targets.legendFormat: timestamp of last sync for tenant {{tenant}}

targets.expr: sum by (direction, tenant) (increase(cloud_logs_archiver_transferred_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", container="cloud-logs-archiver", tenant=~"$tenant"}[$__range]))

sum by(status, tenant)(increase(cloud_logs_archiver_loop_iterations_count{container="cloud-logs-archiver", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", tenant="$tenant", status="succeeded"}[$__rate_interval]))

sum by(status, tenant)(increase(cloud_logs_archiver_loop_iterations_count{container="cloud-logs-archiver", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", tenant="$tenant", status!="succeeded"}[$__rate_interval]))

sum by(status, tenant)(increase(cloud_logs_archiver_validate_index_total{container="cloud-logs-archiver", tenant="$tenant", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", status="success"}[$__rate_interval]))

sum by(status, tenant)(increase(cloud_logs_archiver_validate_index_total{container="cloud-logs-archiver", tenant="$tenant", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", status!="success"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(status, tenant)(increase(cloud_logs_archiver_auditing_runs{container="cloud-logs-archiver", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", tenant="$tenant", status="success"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(status, tenant)(increase(cloud_logs_archiver_auditing_runs{container="cloud-logs-archiver", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", tenant="$tenant", status!="success"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(status, tenant, table)(increase(cloud_logs_archiver_audit_chunks_validated{container="cloud-logs-archiver", tenant="$tenant", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster"}[$__range]))

1.0 - (sum by(table, tenant)(
    cloud_logs_archiver_total_chunks_filtered{cluster=~"$cluster",namespace="$namespace",tenant="$tenant", type="matching"}) /
    sum by(table, tenant)(cloud_logs_archiver_total_chunks_filtered{cluster=~"$cluster",namespace="$namespace",tenant="$tenant", type="not-matching-filter"}))

targets.legendFormat: timestamp of last sync for tenant {{tenant}}

targets.expr: sum by(namespace, cluster, tenant, table)(increase(cloud_logs_archiver_audit_chunks_validated{container="cloud-logs-archiver", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster"}[$__range]))

1.0 - (sum by(table, tenant)(
    cloud_logs_archiver_total_chunks_filtered{cluster=~"$cluster",namespace="$namespace", type="matching"}) /
    sum by(table, tenant)(cloud_logs_archiver_total_chunks_filtered{cluster=~"$cluster",namespace="$namespace", type="not-matching-filter"}))
sum by(namespace, cluster, operation, status_code)(rate(loki_gcs_request_duration_seconds_count{container="cloud-logs-archiver", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(namespace, cluster, operation, status_code)(rate(loki_s3_request_duration_seconds_bucket{container="cloud-logs-archiver", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(namespace, cluster, operation, status_code)(rate(loki_azure_blob_request_duration_seconds_count{container="cloud-logs-archiver", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Export / Rate of Object Storage Operations (Chunks Client)

targets.expr: sum by(namespace, cluster, operation, bucket)(rate(cloud_logs_archiver_objstore_bucket_operations_total{container="cloud-logs-archiver", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster"}[$__rate_interval])) > 0

sum by(namespace, cluster, operation, bucket)(rate(cloud_logs_archiver_objstore_bucket_operation_failures_total{container="cloud-logs-archiver", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster"}[$__rate_interval])) > 0

options.content:
# Storage Operations Visualization

CLE interacts with the object storage on two situations:
1. On every export, which happens in intervals along the day. This process is also named "sync".
2. During the data validation process, also named "audit".

## Expected operations during sync'ing
CLE sync process interacts with the storage through the old Loki chunk client, so its metrics are
the ones exposed by it. The expected operations are:

- A `LIST` to list all indexes files. Send to our bucket.
- A `GET` to download the index file. Send to our bucket.
- A `GET` to download every chunk file. Send to our bucket.
- A `POST` to upload every chunk file. Send to the customer bucket.
- A `POST` to upload schema files. Send to the customer bucket.
- A `POST` to upload the index file. Send to the customer bucket.
- A `HEAD` to every chunk file. Send to the customer bucket.
- A `POST` to update the positions file. Send to our bucket.

## Expected operations during audit
CLE validates the exported data everytime the position for a tenant crosses midnight.
There's an index validation and a chunks validation. The index validation is newer
and not enabled everywhere yet.

The index validation is expected to do the following operations:

- A `GET` to download the index file. Send to our bucket.
- A `GET` to download the index file. Send to the customer bucket.

The chunk validation is expected to do the following operations:

- A `GET` to download the index file. Send to the customer bucket.
- An `ATTRIBUTES` (`HEAD`) to every chunk file. Sent to our bucket.
- An `ATTRIBUTES` (`HEAD`) to every chunk file. Sent to the customer bucket.

panels.title: Rate of HEAD/GET Storage Operations (Chunk Client)
Rate of POST Storage Operations (Chunk Client)

targets.expr: min by(cluster, namespace)(container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", container=~"cloud-logs-archiver", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster"} > 0)

min by(cluster, namespace)(container_spec_cpu_quota{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", container=~"cloud-logs-archiver"} / container_spec_cpu_period{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", container=~"cloud-logs-archiver"})
